name: AzureResourceGroupDeployment
description: Deploy, start, stop, delete Azure Resource Groups
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure RM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Action to be performed on the Azure resources or resource group.

inputs.name: resourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the resource group.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location for deploying the resource group. If the resource group already exists in the subscription, then this value will be ignored.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: templateLocation
inputs.label: Template Location
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: csmFileLink
inputs.label: Template Link
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to the Azure Resource Manager template. For more information about the templates see https://aka.ms/azuretemplates. To get started immediately use template https://aka.ms/sampletemplate.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group && templateLocation = Public URL

inputs.name: csmParametersFileLink
inputs.label: Template Parameters Link
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path for the parameters file for the Azure Resource Manager Template.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group && templateLocation = Public URL

inputs.name: csmFile
inputs.label: Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to the Azure Resource Manager template. For more information about the templates see https://aka.ms/azuretemplates. To get started immediately use template https://aka.ms/sampletemplate.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group && templateLocation = Linked Artifact

inputs.name: csmParametersFile
inputs.label: Template Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path for the parameters file for the Azure Resource Manager Template.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group && templateLocation = Linked Artifact

inputs.name: overrideParameters
inputs.label: Override Template Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the template parameters to override like,
–storageName fabrikam –adminUsername $(vmusername) -adminPassword $(password) –azureKeyVaultName $(fabrikamFibre).
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: deploymentMode
inputs.label: Deployment Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Incremental mode handles deployments as incremental updates to the resource group . It leaves unchanged resources that exist in the resource group but are not specified in the template. 

 Complete mode deletes resources that are not in your template. 

 Validate mode enables you to find problems with the template before creating actual resources. 

 By default, Incremental mode is used.
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group

inputs.name: enableDeploymentPrerequisites
inputs.label: Enable Deployment Prerequisites
inputs.visibleRule: action = Create Or Update Resource Group || action = Select Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this option configures Windows Remote Management (WinRM) listener over HTTPS protocol on port 5986, using a self-signed certificate. This configuration is required for performing deployment operation on Azure machines. If the target Virtual Machines are backed by a Load balancer, ensure Inbound NAT rules are configured for target port (5986).

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a name for the variable for the resource group. The variable can be used as $(variableName) to refer to the resource group in subsequent tasks like in the PowerShell on Target Machines task for deploying applications.
Valid only when the selected action is Create, Update or Select, and required when an existing resource group is selected.
